title-group.article-title: Operating System Requirements for Use in Next-generation In-car Infotainment Systems

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2006 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: Not long ago, an in-dash CD player was considered state-of-the-art for in-car entertainment. Contemporary infotainment and telematics systems include audio, video, voice recognition and synthesis, wireless networking, navigation, internet access, and safety/security features, sometimes running on a single microprocessor. This complexity puts an increasing burden on the microprocessor's operating system. Nextgeneration infotainment systems require next-generation operating system architectures that can handle this challenge.
